Package org.fluentjava.iterators

Interface Summary
ExtendedIterable<T> An Iterable that provides an extendedIterator instead of a Iterable.
ExtendedIterator<T> An iterator that is itself iterable.
 

Class Summary
AbstractExtendedIterator<T> ExtendedIterator that does the default behaviour for iterator() and method: returns itself.
CompositeIterator<F,S> Iterator that takes two Iterators, Iterables, or Arrays (not necesserily both of the same type), and iterates through both, preserving the order.
CountingIterator<T> Extended Iterator Adapter that counts how many times next was invoked, mainly used to count the number of the iteration.
ExtendedIteratorAdapter<T> Adapter that adapts iterable's iterators, iterators (including extended iterators, making this a wrapper as well) and arrays.
Pair<F,S> Simple Pair of types F and S.
